page.title: 05LOWER HARDRES HALL AND CLUBS
page.content: The Village Hall was erected in 1919 from half a YMCA Hut used in the 1914- 18 war. The hut is incorporated within the exisiting building the wooden structure blending well with the rural surroundings. The Hall is used for Whist Drives, Table Tennis, Parish Council Meetings, local societies and hired for private functions and weddings.{The Cottage Gardeners {Society}formed in 1887 has 150 members. Meetings are held monthly during the winter with Speakers and Quizzes. An annual Summer Flower Show is held at Street End Place.{A Judo {Club}formed in 1979 has 80 Junior and 30 Senior members, male and female, training to Black Belt Standard. One member has become British Under 18 Champion.{The over 60 club}with about 20 members meets monthly for a friendly get-together and tea.
